description: This attaches the given property name to the collection, which is in a model
The name of the model key which serves as the unique identifier. Every element with `this-model` should have one.
If none is specified, `id` is assumed
Used on a child of a collection template, it indicates that the child should be shown if all models in the collection have been deleted.
Used on a child of a collection template, it indicates that the child should be shown if the collection is empty
Indicates that the collection should be paginated
Value is the number of results to show per page.
If no value is provided, the config limit apply.
Indicates that new page results should overwrite existing collection content
Indicates that new models should be prepended to the collection listing instead of appended, which is the default
This indicates that the collection should only be loaded once on the page.
When the collection is made a component, it can then be used severally on the same page and even other pages without reloading.
